skill.name: slash-command-encoder
skill.description: Creates ergonomic slash commands for fast access to micro-skills, cascades, and agents with auto-discovery, intelligent routing, parameter validation, and command chaining.
skill.summary: Create ergonomic slash commands with auto-discovery and intelligent routing
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: All 159 static findings are false positives. The detected patterns appear in documentation examples only, not executable code. The skill contains only a SKILL.md documentation file with command examples using backticks for formatting. No actual scripts, network calls, or filesystem operations are present.

content.user_title: Create Fast Slash Commands for AI Workflows
content.value_statement: Transform repetitive AI tasks into fast, scriptable slash commands. This skill generates ergonomic command interfaces for micro-skills, cascades, and agents with automatic discovery, parameter validation, and intelligent routing.
actual_capabilities: Generate slash command interfaces for existing skills and workflows
Auto-discover installed skills and create command catalogs
Design parameter validation schemas with type checking
Create command chaining patterns for composable workflows
Generate comprehensive help documentation and auto-completion
Map commands to micro-skills, cascades, and agent invocations
limitations: Does not execute commands directly, only generates command definitions
Requires manual integration with CLI systems
Command validation schemas need testing with actual use cases
Auto-discovery patterns are conceptual and need implementation

use_cases.title: Power User Workflow Shortcuts
use_cases.description: Create fast slash commands for daily development tasks like code audits, testing pipelines, and deployment workflows to replace repetitive natural language prompts.
use_cases.target_user: Software developers who perform repeated operations

use_cases.title: Team Command Standardization
use_cases.description: Build consistent command interfaces across team skills and tools to enable scriptable automation and reduce onboarding time for new team members.

use_cases.title: Multi-Model Command Routing
use_cases.description: Design commands that intelligently route tasks to optimal AI models based on context size, task type, and performance requirements.
use_cases.target_user: AI engineers orchestrating multiple model backends

prompt_templates.title: Basic Command Creation

prompt_templates.scenario: Simple command for a single micro-skill

prompt_templates.title: Command with Parameters

prompt_templates.title: Command Pipeline

prompt_templates.title: Full Skill Catalog
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a complete command catalog for all skills in ~/.claude/skills/ with auto-completion and help documentation

output_examples.input: Create /audit-pipeline command for code quality workflow
output_examples.output: Command definition with name, parameters (target directory, --phase flag, --output option), routing to audit-pipeline cascade, parameter validation schema, usage examples, and help documentation showing sequential phases (theater detection, functionality audit, style audit).

output_examples.input: Design /agent-rca command for root cause analysis
output_examples.output: Agent invocation command with required task description parameter, optional --context and --depth flags, routing configuration to root-cause-analyzer agent, auto-completion for depth values (shallow, normal, deep), and example usage patterns.

output_examples.input: Generate command catalog for installed skills
output_examples.output: Comprehensive catalog organized by category showing 14 commands: audit commands (theater-detect, functionality-audit, style-audit, audit-pipeline), multi-model commands (gemini-megacontext, codex-auto, etc.), agent commands (agent-rca), and skill creation commands, each with brief descriptions and parameter summaries.

best_practices: Use verb-noun naming pattern for clarity and limit positional parameters to maximum three
Include comprehensive help text and example usage for every command
Design commands to be composable with pipe-friendly input/output interfaces
anti_patterns: Creating commands for one-off exploratory tasks better suited to natural language
Using complex parameter structures that reduce command typing speed
Generating commands without validation schemas that lead to runtime errors

faq.question: Does this skill execute commands or just generate definitions?
faq.answer: This skill generates command definitions, documentation, and routing configurations. The actual command execution requires integration with Claude Code CLI or similar command systems.

faq.question: How does auto-discovery of skills work?
faq.answer: The skill designs patterns to scan SKILL.md files in standard directories, extract metadata like name and parameters, and generate corresponding command definitions with proper routing.

faq.question: Can commands route to different AI models?
faq.answer: Yes, commands can include --model flags to explicitly select Claude, Gemini, or Codex, or use auto-routing logic that selects optimal models based on task characteristics like context size.

faq.question: What is command chaining and how does it work?
faq.answer: Command chaining connects multiple commands with pipes or operators to create workflows. Each command accepts input from previous steps and passes output to next steps using standard interfaces.

faq.question: Are the generated commands compatible with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Commands follow Claude Code patterns and can be registered by creating command definition files in the .claude/commands directory with proper metadata and routing information.

faq.question: How do I add parameter validation to commands?
faq.answer: Define validation schemas specifying parameter types (string, number, file_path, enum), required flags, default values, and custom validation functions that check values before command execution.
